params._checkpoint: Total amount of tokens claimed by user (enables to claim multiple epochs at once)
params._epoch: Epoch ID associated to the claim
params._index: Position of user's address in the merkle tree
params._proof: Merkle proof to verify user is entitled to claim
params._redeemShares: Boolean to allow user to redeem underlying tokens of a yearn vault (prerequisite: _token must be a yvToken)

params._circles: Array of Circle IDs of the user
params._epochsIndexesCheckpoints: Array contaning  Epoch IDs, indexes of user in merkle trees and checkpoints associated to the claim
params._proofs: Array of merkle proofs to verify user is entitled to claim
params._redeemShares: Boolean array  to allow user to redeem underlying tokens of a yearn vault (prerequisite: _token must be a yvToken)
params._tokensAndAccounts: Array containing token addresses and accounts of user

params._amount: Amount to take out at most
params._epochs: Amount of epochs to fund. Expected_funded_epochs = _epochs + 1
params._interval: Duration of an epoch in seconds
params._intervalStart: Unix timestamp fromw hich epoch starts (block.timestamp if 0)

params._admin: Address of allowed admin to call `uploadEpochRoot`

params._root: Merkle root of the current circle's epoch
params._tapType: Ape vault's type tap (pure profit, mixed, simple token)
params._token: Address of the token to withdraw from the vault
params._vault: Address of ape vault from which to take funds from

claim(bytes32,address,uint256,uint256,ad.notice: Used to allow circle users to claim their allocation of a given epoch

claimMany(bytes32[],address[],uint256[],.notice: Used to allow circle users to claim many tokens at once if applicable Operated similarly to the `claim` function but due to "Stack too deep errors", input data was concatenated into similar typed arrays

setAllowance(bytes32,address,uint256,uin.notice: Used to set an allowance of a circle from an ape vault. Setting _epochs at 0 with a non-zero _amount entitles the circle to one epoch of funds

updateCircleAdmin(bytes32,address).notice: Used to allow an ape vault owner to set an admin for a circle

uploadEpochRoot(address,bytes32,address,.notice: Used to allow a circle to supply an epoch with funds from a given ape vault
